station.name: INDIAN CLASSICAL/FOLK/ETHNIC
station.longDesc: Indian classical music is one of the oldest complex musical traditions of the world. Its origins are traditionally associated with the Vedas, primarily with the “Sama Veda” (2 thousand BC), dwelling on music in more detail than other Vedas (explaining how to play the hymns of the Rig Veda) and strongly connecting the sources of music with the religious and magical practice of Hinduism. The treatise on theater, music and dance “Natya-shastra”. Demonstrates that before its creation, Indians had a highly developed musical system. It also captures the important connection between music and dance and drama. Under the influence of Muslim culture in the Middle Ages, the melody performance of author's poetry, which was adapted by Indian culture and became an important part of classical music, became important.

station.name: RUSSIAN FOLK
station.longDesc: Russian folk song is a song whose words and music have developed historically in the course of the development of Russian culture. The folk song does not have a specific author, or the author is unknown. Among the main genres of folk music can be identified calendar ritual songs, wedding, epic, dance and lyrical songs. Folk music was more song than instrumental (possibly influenced by the church ban on Russian musical instruments).

station.name: ORTHODOX SPIRITUAL MUSIC
station.longDesc: Orthodox music is a colloquial phrase, usually meaning music associated mainly with the worship of the Byzantine rite in the Orthodox Church or with the Orthodox worship of Ancient Russia. However, this phrase means different types of both Orthodox liturgical and non-liturgical singing.

station.name: LAIKA/ GREEK MUSIC
station.longDesc: Until the 1930s, two musical genres dominated Greek music: Greek folk music (including cleft songs) and the elafro song genre (the literal translation is “light song”). The latter was represented by ensembles of singers, musicians and solo performers, such as Cleon Triantafillu and Nikos Gunaris. It was the Greek interpretation of international popular music of the time.

station.name: GOSPEL/SPIRITUALS MUSIC
station.longDesc: Gospel music, Gospel music (English Gospel music - evangelical music) is a genre of spiritual Christian music that developed in the first third of the 20th century in the USA. Usually distinguish Negro gospel and white gospel. What is common is that both were born in the Methodist churches of the American South.

station.name: EUROPEAN FOLK
station.longDesc: Folk music, folk music, musical and poetic creativity of the people, an integral part of folk art, existing, as a rule, in oral form, transmitted from generation to generation.

station.name: FLAMENCO
station.longDesc: Flamenco (isp. Flamenco) - traditional music and dance style originating from Andalusia (Spain); it is a fusion of music, singing and dance. The style is represented by several dozen varieties (over 50). Dancing and flamenco songs are usually accompanied by a guitar and a percussion: rhythmic clapping, playing a percussion box (kahon); sometimes - castanets.

station.name: TANGO
station.longDesc: Tango (isp. Tango) - Argentine folk dance; pair dance free composition, characterized by an energetic and clear rhythm. Originally performed exclusively by men.

station.name: MIDDLE EASTERN MUSIC
station.longDesc: The music of the Middle East is an important part of world culture. Its roots are in the musical traditions of the ancient Arabs, Persians, Egyptians, Jews, Greeks and other peoples who lived in North Africa, on the Arabian Peninsula and in the Mediterranean. It differs from Western music with its special tonal structure, increased attention to love lyrics, philosophy and mysticism. Due to tough musical canons, many features of the ancient musical culture of the Middle East have survived to this day.

station.name: AFRICAN FOLK/ETHNIC
station.longDesc: The term “African music” means the music of the peoples south of the Sahara desert. The music is distinguished by a complex rhythmic structure and originality of the musical modes of each ethnic group. An important role in traditional music is played by various percussions (drums, sansa, xylophone) and wind instruments (various flute variants, horns).

station.name: MUSIC OF SIBERIA/MONGOLIA
station.longDesc: The first evidence of the birth of musical culture of Siberia are contained in archaeological sites. Rock paintings (petroglyphs) depicting rituals accompanied by music were found in the Gorny Altai caves (Kamennaya, Denisova, Ust-Karakol, Kara-Bom, Terrible), Irkutsk Region (Yelantsy), Tuva (Ching-Dag-Uzhu, Pestunovka Cave), Khakassia (grotto Two-eyes ). As a result of the excavations on the territory of Siberia, samples (fragments) of some musical instruments (Scythian harp), various decoys for beckoning birds and animals, human figures, which gave an idea of ​​the elements of the ritual dance of a shaman and other ritual dances, were found.

station.name: FADO
station.longDesc: Fado (English Fado) - Portuguese music (historically, also dance) genre. Literally, the word “Fado” means “Fatum”, “Fate”, the dominant emotion in the works is the acceptance of a bitter fate. The main varieties are Lisbon and Coimbra fado.

station.name: CELTIC
station.longDesc: Celtic music (eng. Celtic music) is a term used to denote the totality of musical traditions of peoples who are descendants of the Celts. Modern descendants of the Celts live in Ireland, Scotland, Maine, Cornwall, Brittany, Wales, Galicia, Asturias and Cantabria. Synthesis of Celtic music with the genres of popular music spawned a whole direction - Celtic-fusion.

station.name: NATIVE AMERICAN
station.longDesc: Native American music is music that is used, created, or performed by Native Americans in the United States and the original peoples of Canada, in particular, traditional tribal music.

station.name: BALKAN MUSIC
station.longDesc: The Balkan Peninsula is located in the south-east of Europe. This region amazes with a variety of nationalities, languages, religions, landscapes and, as a result, musical styles. Despite all the differences, many common threads link the musical life of the region.

station.name: CAUCASIAN MUSIC
station.longDesc: The Caucasus is one of the most multinational regions, the bulk of the Caucasian (indigenous) peoples are concentrated here. He has unique natural and social characteristics of ethnic culture.

station.name: INDIAN SPIRITUAL MUSIC
station.longDesc: Mantras are compared to psalms, prayers and spells. Hindus believe that mantra is a definite form of speech that has a significant effect on the mind, emotions, and even external objects. Usually a mantra is a combination of several sounds or words in Sanskrit.

station.name: TRADITIONAL LATIN MUSIC
station.longDesc: Salsa (isp. Salsa - “sauce”) is a musical genre popular mainly in Latin America and among those who come from it. Salsa includes many styles and variations; In a broad sense, the term can be used for almost any music of Cuban origin (for example, cha-cha-cha, bolero, mambo).

station.name: FAR EASTERN MUSIC
station.longDesc: The region of the Far East throughout history has developed with the centrism of China. The influence of Chinese civilization, its philosophical and ideological doctrines of Confucianism, Buddhism and Taoism extended to all spheres of social life, which naturally determined a certain kinship in philosophy, theory, and specifically, in the forms and genres of music.

station.name: JEWISH MUSIC/KLEZMER
station.longDesc: Jewish music is a household, secular and cult music of the Jewish diaspora, as well as the works of Jewish composers who write on the basis of Jewish musical folklore.

station.name: AMERICANA
station.longDesc: Americana (eng. Americana or americana music) is modern music that contains elements of various genres of American traditional music (country, folk, bluegrass, blues, gospel, R & B), has a characteristic traditionally-oriented sound, but cannot be clearly defined as One of these genres.

station.name: MEDIEVAL FOLK
station.longDesc: Medieval Folk (eng. Medieval Folk) - music performed on ancient instruments, recreating the authentic atmosphere of the Middle Ages, iridescent colorful melodies, telling about epic holidays and the daily life of ordinary peasants. For the most part, the music is bright and light, reveals the era of the Middle Ages mainly from the positive side.
